isis.stitle: DT/DTI-466 A and B Series DT/DTI/DTA-466 C Diesel Engine Diagnostics (1993) - ENGINE DIAGNOSTIC TEST PROCEDURES - DT/DTI/DTA - 466 C SERIES DIESEL ENGINES - ACCELERATOR LINKAGE DT/DTI/DTA-466 C Engines (With Robert Bosch "MW" or "A" Fuel Injection Pump) - LINKAGE ADJUSTMENT: (With Bellcrank)

svcprocinfo.para: Refer to Figure 6.14 for Version "I" Linkage, Figure 6.16 for Version "II" Linkage, and Figure 6.17 for Version "III" Linkage.

important.para: BALL JOINTS AND BELLCRANK SHAFT MUST ROTATE FREELY WITHOUT BINDING OR STICKING. THE BALL JOINTS, BELLCRANK SHAFT, BORE AND BUSHING INSERTS MUST BE FREE OF PAINT, GREASE, OIL, DIRT, RUST, OR ANY OTHER FOREIGN MATERIAL. CLEAN OR REPLACE PARTS IF NECESSARY.
MAKE THE FOLLOWING ADJUSTMENTS AFTER THE ENGINE HAS BEEN RUN-IN AND THE INJECTION PUMP HAS BEEN SET.

svcsubproc.title: Version "I" Linkage With Standard Regulation Governor ( Figure 6.14)

step1.para: Position the bellcrank bracket and control lever as follows:

step2.para: Locate the bellcrank shaft centerline 15.82" ± 0.06" from front finish of the flywheel housing (cranking motor pad). Loosen the bracket mounting hardware for this adjustment, if required.

Insert a 3/16" dia. ( 1.875" drill ) gauge pin through the holes (Figure 6.14)
of the bellcrank bracket and control lever.

step1.para: Assemble the throttle lever on the pump shaft. Do NOT position the lever in the shaft groove.

step2.para:
With the pump shaft in the low idle position, relocate the pump lever to the gauge dimension shown in Figure 6.14.
Do not force the lever into over-travel for this positioning (Figure 6.15)
.

The spacer (Figure 6.14)
must be installed on the lever clamping bolt inside the lever slot to prevent lever breakage. Tighten the clamping bolt to 55 lbf-in. (6 N-m) (Figure 6.14).

step1.para: Install the control rod assembly as follows:

step2.para: Hold the injection pump lever against the low idle stop (do not force the pump lever into the over-travel position).

warning.para: Exposed threads above either control rod nut must not exceed 0.42 in. (Figure 6.14).

step2.para: Position the control rod ends so that the ball joint banjo face is aligned parallel with the lever mounting face. Then tighten the control rod nuts.
Remove the gauge pin.
Rotate the control lever counterclockwise from low idle to high idle and past high idle to maximum over-travel.

Observe maximum over-travel at the injection pump lever. The injection pump lever tang bottoms in the lever slot when maximum over-travel is reached. DO NOT force beyond this point. Pump lever, pump, or linkage components will be damaged if excessive force is used.
Release the control lever and let the springs return the linkage to low idle.

Repeat 4a thru 4c two more times. If the linkage has been properly adjusted, the linkage will return to the low idle position. The gauge holes will be aligned and the injection pump lever tang will be centered in the slot.

important.para: BEFORE STARTING THE ENGINE, ENTER THE OPERATOR'S COMPARTMENT AND DEPRESS THE THROTTLE PEDAL SEVERAL TIMES TO CHECK FOR SMOOTH ACTION AND FULL RETURN OF THE THROTTLE LEVER AND THROTTLE PEDAL. THIS MUST BE DONE ANY TIME COMPONENTS ARE REPLACED, REASSEMBLED OR ADJUSTED.
